Alternative: event-driven architecture | Rejected because: operational overhead for this scope.
Claim: queueing lowers p95 latency. Falsified if p95 latency increases after rollout.
Claim: queueing lowers p95 latency | Confidence: 0.84
Unknown: weekend traffic burst profile.

Alternative: keep existing scheduler | Rejected because: cannot meet throughput target.
Claim: sharding improves throughput. Falsified if throughput does not improve at equivalent load.
Claim: sharding improves throughput | Confidence: 0.88
Unknown: exact peak concurrency of new customers.

Alternative: single-region failover | Rejected because: does not meet regional resilience requirement.
Claim: active-active deployment improves resilience. Falsified if regional outage still causes full service interruption.
Claim: active-active deployment improves resilience | Confidence: 0.79
Unknown: cross-region failback latency during peak write traffic.

Alternative: keep monolith | Rejected because: deploy coupling remains high.
Claim: service split will reduce deploy risk | Confidence: 0.76
Unknown: migration timeline risk.

Alternative: big-bang rewrite | Rejected because: delivery risk is too high.
Claim: staged migration reduces outage risk. Falsified if incident rate rises over baseline.
Claim: staged migration reduces outage risk | Confidence: 0.81
Unknown: team capacity during quarter-end.

Alternative: defer migration by one quarter | Rejected because: we continue paying high operational cost.
Claim: phased database migration lowers operational toil. Falsified if on-call pages do not trend downward within 60 days.
Claim: phased database migration lowers operational toil | Confidence: 0.74
Unknown: potential vendor throttling behavior during cutover.

ALTERNATIVES CONSIDERED
FALSIFIABILITY
CONFIDENCE LEVELS
EXPLICIT UNKNOWNS

This is the operating framework for everything and clearly superior.
Confidence: 0.99
We should proceed now because the concept is compelling.
